attributes.content: Port Authority of Dakar (PAD) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Port Authority of Dakar (PAD) is strategically located at the intersection of major maritime routes connecting Europe, South America, North America, and South Africa. Established in 1987, PAD's main responsibilities include operating and maintaining the seaport of Dakar, managing its facilities, and ensuring safe navigation for vessels. It offers a variety of services, such as piloting, towing, refueling, and mooring, and handles both cargo and passenger traffic.

attributes.content: Black Females in Architecture | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Black Females in Architecture (BFA) is a social enterprise dedicated to supporting Black women in architecture, design, and construction. With nearly 500 members, BFA advocates for diversity, equity, and inclusion in an industry where Black women make up less than 1% of the workforce. Through networking, education, and collaborative projects, BFA empowers members to influence the built environment and challenge conventional narratives about architects.

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: The Port Authority of Cotonou | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Port Authority of Cotonou (PAC) is a public organization established on December 31, 1964, with a share capital of approximately 342.6 billion CFA. Inaugurated on August 1, 1965, with the "Marechal FOCH," PAC manages the Port of Cotonou, a vital economic hub for Benin and the region. With over 600 employees, PAC holds certifications in environmental policy, quality management, and occupational health and safety. In 2018, it partnered with the Port of Antwerp Bruges International to drive modernization and skills transfer.

body.value: The Port Authority of Cotonou (PAC) is a public organization established on December 31, 1964, with a share capital of approximately 342.6 billion CFA. Inaugurated on August 1, 1965, with the "Marechal FOCH," PAC manages the Port of Cotonou, a vital economic hub for Benin and the region. With over 600 employees, PAC holds certifications in environmental policy, quality management, and occupational health and safety. In 2018, it partnered with the Port of Antwerp Bruges International to drive modernization and skills transfer. By 2026, PAC plans to invest over 450 billion CFA in twelve major projects to enhance infrastructure and establish the Port of Cotonou as a modern, secure logistics platform.

Its primary mission is to support Member States in enhancing their public health initiatives and strengthening the capacity of their institutions to effectively detect, prevent, control, and respond to disease threats. Africa CDC provides coordinated solutions to address challenges in public health infrastructure, human resources, disease surveillance, laboratory diagnostics, and emergency preparedness.

attributes.content: MDS Architecture is one of the oldest established architectural firms in South Africa. Since its formation in 1954, the firm has consistently balanced design excellence with commercial considerations in its projects. body.value:
MDS Architecture is one of the oldest established architectural firms in South Africa. Since its formation in 1954, the firm has consistently balanced design excellence with commercial considerations in its projects. This ability to accurately interpret client requirements has fostered enduring relationships with developers and financial institutions.

Despite having a staff of over 40 people, all projects are led by one of the firm's five partners, maintaining a culture and ethos of an intimate practice. This approach ensures the delivery of thoughtful, original, and contemporary architecture, which has become the hallmark of buildings designed by MDS Architecture.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: China Railway 19th Bureau Group Co., Ltd. was formerly the 9th Railway Division of the Chinese People's Liberation Army. It was established in August 1949 and has gone through different historical periods such as the Changsha Uprising, the Guangxi Bandit Suppression, Jingjiang Flood Diversion, the War to Resist US Aggression and Aid Korea, and domestic construction. In January 1984, it was collectively transferred to the Ministry of Railways and reorganized into the 19th Engineering Bureau of the Ministry of Railways. They offers engineering construction services.

body.value: China Railway 19th Bureau Group Co., Ltd. was formerly the 9th Railway Division of the Chinese People's Liberation Army. It was established in August 1949 and has gone through different historical periods such as the Changsha Uprising, the Guangxi Bandit Suppression, Jingjiang Flood Diversion, the War to Resist US Aggression and Aid Korea, and domestic construction. In January 1984, it was collectively transferred to the Ministry of Railways and reorganized into the 19th Engineering Bureau of the Ministry of Railways. They offers engineering construction services. The Company constructs bridges, airports, harbours, tunnels, railways, highways, and municipal public works. China Railway 19th Bureau Group also manufactures construction equipment.

attributes.content: The National Irrigation Authority (Kenya) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The National Irrigation Authority was established on August 16, 2019, by the Irrigation Act No. 14 of 2019 as a successor institution to the National Irrigation Board. This followed the assent of the Irrigation Bill of 2019 by His Excellency the President on July 29, 2019, leading to its publication in the Kenya Gazette Supplement No. 136 (Acts No. 14) on August 2, 2019.

body.value:
The National Irrigation Authority was established on August 16, 2019, by the Irrigation Act No. 14 of 2019 as a successor institution to the National Irrigation Board. This followed the assent of the Irrigation Bill of 2019 by His Excellency the President on July 29, 2019, leading to its publication in the Kenya Gazette Supplement No. 136 (Acts No. 14) on August 2, 2019.

The objective of the Irrigation Act 2019 is to provide for the development, management, and regulation of irrigation, to support sustainable food security and socioeconomic development in Kenya, and for connected purposes.

Irrigation in Kenya is well-anchored in Vision 2030, the Third Medium Term Plan (MTP III) 2018-2022, and the Big Four Agenda 2018-2022, and further detailed in the Authority’s Strategic Plan 2019-2023. The Irrigation Act is also intended to support sustainable food production by clearly outlining the roles of national and county governments in facilitating irrigation activities in Kenya.

The National Irrigation Authority was established on August 16, 2019, by the Irrigation Act No. 14 of 2019 as a successor institution to the National Irrigation Board. This followed the assent of the Irrigation Bill of 2019 by His Excellency the President on July 29, 2019, leading to its publication in the Kenya Gazette Supplement No. 136 (Acts No. 14) on August 2, 2019.

The objective of the Irrigation Act 2019 is to provide for the development, management, and regulation of irrigation, to support sustainable food security and socioeconomic development in Kenya, and for connected purposes.

Irrigation in Kenya is well-anchored in Vision 2030, the Third Medium Term Plan (MTP III) 2018-2022, and the Big Four Agenda 2018-2022, and further detailed in the Authority’s Strategic Plan 2019-2023. The Irrigation Act is also intended to support sustainable food production by clearly outlining the roles of national and county governments in facilitating irrigation activities in Kenya.

body.value:
The statutory specification and establishment of government ministries and agencies in Liberia aim to create opportunities for specialization, thereby achieving maximum gross output in administering the economic, political, and engineering components of the state as a single unit.

In line with the government’s objective to achieve national goals cohesively, the Department of Public Works was established by an Act of the National Legislature in 1928. It was later renamed the Ministry of Public Works in 1972 to better administer the engineering component of the state. This includes responsibilities such as surveying, drafting/designing, construction, and supervision. The Ministry is tasked with improving and maintaining all highways, bridges, roads, streets, airports, seaports, and other public infrastructure in the Republic of Liberia, either directly or through contracts.

The Ministry is tasked with improving and maintaining all highways, bridges, roads, streets, airports, seaports, and other public infrastructure in the Republic of Liberia, either directly or through contracts.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Founded on August 29, 1956 as Rio Tinto Southern Rhodesia Ltd., RioZim initially focused on developing and mining the Empress Nickel deposit in Midlands marked Rio Tinto plc's first mining venture outside Europe.

body.value:
Founded on August 29, 1956 as Rio Tinto Southern Rhodesia Ltd., RioZim initially focused on developing and mining the Empress Nickel deposit in Midlands marked Rio Tinto plc's first mining venture outside Europe.

In 2004, RioZim transitioned to become a wholly owned Zimbabwean entity following its separation from Rio Tinto plc. Today, RioZim is a key player in Zimbabwe's mining sector, specializing in the production of gold, coal, toll refining of nickel and copper. Listed on the Zimbabwe Stock Exchange (ZSE), the company has redefined its vision, mission, and values since the separation, while achieving certifications for quality, occupational health, safety, and environmental management across its operations.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Founded in 1992 by engineer Jörg Müller, Enertrag SE has been a pioneer in recognizing the significance of renewable energy for our collective future. Its inaugural wind farm, conceived in 1989 and erected in 1993 in Germany’s Uckermark region, remains operational today. With a rich history of developing and managing high-yield renewable energy projects, Enertrag proudly boasts an installed capacity of 760MW and a workforce exceeding 500 employees. Currently, the company oversees and operates over 1000 turbines globally.

attributes.content: The Green Climate Fund (GCF) supports developing countries in leading climate action by implementing their Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) through practical projects. It collaborates with a broad network of over 200 Accredited Entities and partners, including banks, UN agencies, and civil society, aiming to foster innovative partnerships and standardize practices. GCF utilizes grants, concessional loans, and equity to attract private investment and experiment with new financial models.

body.value: The Green Climate Fund (GCF) supports developing countries in leading climate action by implementing their Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) through practical projects. It collaborates with a broad network of over 200 Accredited Entities and partners, including banks, UN agencies, and civil society, aiming to foster innovative partnerships and standardize practices. GCF utilizes grants, concessional loans, and equity to attract private investment and experiment with new financial models. Key sectors prioritized include buildings, energy, human security, and ecosystems, integrating strategies for mitigation, adaptation, and sustainable development. Climate risk assessments are integrated into investment decisions to ensure financial flows contribute to long-term sustainability objectives.
body.processed: The Green Climate Fund (GCF) supports developing countries in leading climate action by implementing their Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) through practical projects. GCF utilizes grants, concessional loans, and equity to attract private investment and experiment with new financial models. Key sectors prioritized include buildings, energy, human security, and ecosystems, integrating strategies for mitigation, adaptation, and sustainable development. Climate risk assessments are integrated into investment decisions to ensure financial flows contribute to long-term sustainability objectives.

EU Delegations outside the EU, managed by the European External Action Service, promote EU policies and conduct outreach programs to advance EU interests.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Direction Nationale Des Routes (DNR), or National Directorate of Roads, is a governmental body found in various countries, including France. It is responsible for managing, planning, constructing, and maintaining national road networks. The DNR's key responsibilities include infrastructure management, maintenance, establishing regulatory standards, traffic management, emergency response coordination, environmental impact assessment, and public information dissemination.

body.value: The Direction Nationale Des Routes (DNR), or National Directorate of Roads, is a governmental body found in various countries, including France. It is responsible for managing, planning, constructing, and maintaining national road networks. The DNR's key responsibilities include infrastructure management, maintenance, establishing regulatory standards, traffic management, emergency response coordination, environmental impact assessment, and public information dissemination. Its primary objective is to ensure the safe and efficient operation of national road infrastructure, fostering economic growth, regional connectivity, and enhancing overall transportation systems. Specific roles and structures of DNRs can vary by country, but they universally aim to optimize national road network functionality.
